channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: TikTok videos humanise Colombia's cocaine workers
item.description: Social media videos in Colombia reveal how the people on the lowest rung of the cocaine industry work and live.

item.title: Astroworld: Rapper Travis Scott 'devastated' after music festival deaths
item.description: The rapper speaks for the first time after at least eight people died after a crowd surge during his set.

item.title: Afghanistan hunger: 'The worst humanitarian crisis on Earth'
item.description: Afghanistan faces widespread famine with millions affected, says the UN World Food Programme head.

item.title: Diamonds v trees: The community trying to save its forest
item.description: The Madhya Pradesh state government says a new diamond mine will bring jobs but local people say their lives will be destroyed.

item.title: The space telescopes inspired by lobsters
item.description: By mimicking the way lobsters’ eyes work, scientists have designed new X-ray space telescopes that can survey much larger areas.

item.title: Former K-Pop star Henry Lau's art work on show in London
item.description: Former K-Pop boy band star Henry Lau trades the mic in for a tin of paint for his latest project.

item.title: Climate: Making the BBC’s Life at 50C season
item.description: The BBC’s Life at 50C season, follows those people living on the front line of climate change.

item.title: ICYMI: From bright lights to great heights
item.description: Our weekly video round-up of some of the stories that might have passed you by: In Case You Missed It.

item.title: COP 26: What Alaska’s shrinking island means for all of us
item.description: Melting ice and rising sea levels threaten this community's existence. It's a warning to the world.

item.title: Colin Powell: Funeral for 'great lion with big heart'
item.description: US presidents, past and present, attended the service to remember the former secretary of state.

item.title: Ros Atkins on… tree planting and climate change
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at why vast tree-planting initiatives are concerning some experts.

item.title: Abba on new album Voyage: We don't need to prove anything
item.description: As the band release Voyage, Benny and Bjorn speak to the BBC about being compared to their old music.

item.title: COP26: Indigenous Amazon activist 'got death threats' after speech
item.description: Txai Suruí says she worries for her safety and that of other young climate activists.

item.title: Nostalgia-soaked photos immortalise LA roller rink
item.description: Flipper's Roller Boogie Palace was a place for children and celebrities alike to roller skate.

item.title: How fresh is your food? Sensors could show you
item.description: Households contribute the most food waste - so what if you could track spoilage in real time?

item.title: Cleo Smith: Listen to the moment police rescued missing girl
item.description: Listen to the moment police in Western Australia found a four-year-old girl who had been missing for 18 days.

item.title: Amanda Knox on how she thinks her case would be viewed today
item.description: She speaks about losing control of her identity during the Meredith Kercher murder investigation.
